I usually take it a few hours before sleep to mitigate some of the fatigue.  I'm pretty sure there's better medications for this as this was primarily an old allergy medication.  Be careful as it can cause some serious drug interactions with other meds/antibiotics.

I was prescribed this medication (ranging between 25 and 50mg) for panic attacks and insomnia. I began taking this medication on a daily basis for sedation in September of 2021. It did (and still does) help me sleep through the night, but the weight gain is huge! I subtly put on 10 pounds in the fall, but assumed it was from lifting more often. Nope. My weight was taken at a doctor's appointment in late February 2022 and I had put on ANOTHER 10-15 pounds. I did not change my diet or exercise. Never have I ever gained this much weight from a medication, even after taking nearly all of the atypical antipsychotics, SSRIs/SNRIs, beta blockers, etc. I am now categorized as overweight, which is mind-blowing. I went from 135 pounds (5'5) to 155lbs. The weight gain has destroyed my mental health and thrown off any confidence (which was little to begin with) I did have. I would switch back to Ambien before taking this medication ever again.

It works well for me, but just 10mg.  Maybe some people are taking a dose that is too high.  I was prescribed for bladder spasms but find that it also helps with insomnia which I have had all my life.  I do need to take it at least an hour before going to bed
I take 50 milligrams an hour before bed and sleep is effortless. I just drift away into a dead sleep. I do feel groggy the next day, but it’s better than being tired.

I’ve been taking hydroxyzine since I was pregnant for sleep. I’ve been on it for 4 years now. I’d say it works better than nothing, but I’m not certain I’m actually sleeping when I take it. I often think I’m dreaming and realize I’m awake and just daydreaming. Despite taking it, I am always tired. If I don’t take it, I get extremely nauseas. Recently, I started noticing I was having memory problems. I would be driving and momentarily not know where I was. I also forget words a lot. I’m 35 years old, so I found this to be concerning. I looked this drug up, and it can cause these kinds of problems long term. After not taking it for a week, I’m the still exhausted. My sleep is pretty poor. However, I’m definitely more motivated and don’t feel the brain fog. I think I’ll just start taking hydroxyzine as needed from here on out.

It definitely helped me sleep longer. 9 hours instead of 5 or 6 but I woke up groggy and out of sorts. Throughout the day I felt my brain was not being sharp (so forgetful and feeling lost) and then I got a terrible headache and ended up going to bed at 3pm in the afternoon and slept on and off till the next day. the second day was emotional and very confusing laced with tiredness.This all on one 25mg pill. Never again will I take this medication. I am calling these pills 'crazy pills'. I will return them to the pharmacy.

Most of the drugs only act in the ways they should without adverse events in about 60 to 70% of the population.  I made an Excel document and loaded every drug in it that I have an adverse reaction to. Then I looked up every drug on that list and entered into the Excel file which substrate is utilized in the CYP450 complex for each drug. It's amazing to me the side effects and adverse events I'm getting from drugs in different drug classes but they utilize the same CYP450 pathways. I digress. Even someone with my education gets panic attacks which all kinds of other therapies with top psychologists did not put a dent in. So I took 5 mg. I took half of a 10 mg pill. I slept for an entire day and I felt destroyed the next day. My eyes and mouth. Confusion. Scattered. Slow. Scary. I had to drive the next day. Unsafe.

I've been taking it for sleep for a few months it makes me feel like I'm still awake while I'm sleeping -like I'm in zombie mode and it makes my arms and legs twitch all night. My wife tells me I'm having tremors at night when I do sleep some nights I do actually get sleep but I've had insomnia for 25 years so for me it is  like so, so.

I was prescribed this to help me sleep around 3 years ago. 25 mg every night (or day if I was working overnight). While it did help me sleep well, I have gained 20 pounds over this time frame in spite of being an avid runner and weight lifter. I was feeling so hungry all the time. Took hydroxyzine usually works at helping me sleep last night body fought off affects of sedation tried taking a muscle relaxer body still unable to sleep disappointed with this so had doctor prescribe trazodone to help me hopefully this works better tired of only getting 1-2 hours of sleep a night.

Took hydroxyzine for 3 weeks for insomnia relief, didn't help much and developed all kinds of side effects like panic, anxiety, depression, muscle jerks, brain fog and memory problems.
